title: Orange Jam
summary: Sweet and tangy preserve made from local Cretan oranges.

instructions.value: Wash oranges thoroughly. Using a vegetable peeler, remove the zest in strips, avoiding the white pith.
Cut zest into thin julienne strips. Peel oranges completely and chop the flesh, removing seeds.
In a large pot, combine orange zest, chopped oranges, water, and cinnamon stick. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes until the zest is tender.
Add sugar and lemon juice. Stir until sugar dissolves completely.
Increase heat to medium-high and boil for 15-20 minutes, stirring frequently, until the mixture thickens and reaches jam consistency.
Test by placing a small amount on a cold plate - it should wrinkle when pushed with your finger.
Remove cinnamon stick. Pour into sterilized jars and seal while hot.
Store in a cool, dark place. Refrigerate after opening.

tips_and_notes: Use organic oranges to avoid pesticide residue on the zest
Don't skip the lemon juice - it helps with setting and adds brightness
Properly sealed jars will keep for up to a year
